trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate ADM with Engagement
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate ADM with Engagement

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: This document is useful only if you integrated the Reach module for any time campaign support.
trans-unit.target: This document is useful only if you integrated the Reach module for any time campaign support.

trans-unit.source: To integrate Reach campaigns in your application, please read first How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android.
trans-unit.target: To integrate Reach campaigns in your application, please read first How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android.

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Integrating ADM allows your application to be pushed even when it's not running.
trans-unit.target: Integrating ADM allows your application to be pushed even when it's not running.

trans-unit.source: No campaign data is actually sent via ADM, it's just a background signal telling the application to fetch the Engagement push.
trans-unit.target: No campaign data is actually sent via ADM, it's just a background signal telling the application to fetch the Engagement push.

trans-unit.source: If the application is not running while receiving an ADM push, it triggers a connection to the Engagement servers to fetch the push, the Engagement connection remains active for about a minute in case the user launches the application in the response to the push.
trans-unit.target: If the application is not running while receiving an ADM push, it triggers a connection to the Engagement servers to fetch the push, the Engagement connection remains active for about a minute in case the user launches the application in the response to the push.

trans-unit.source: Only Amazon Kindle devices running Android 4.0.3 or above are supported by Amazon Device Messaging; however, you can integrate this code safely on other devices.
trans-unit.target: Only Amazon Kindle devices running Android 4.0.3 or above are supported by Amazon Device Messaging; however, you can integrate this code safely on other devices.

trans-unit.source: If the application cannot be woken up by ADM, the Engagement notification will be received the next time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: If the application cannot be woken up by ADM, the Engagement notification will be received the next time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: Sign up to ADM
trans-unit.target: Sign up to ADM

trans-unit.source: If not already done, you must enable ADM on your Amazon account.
trans-unit.target: If not already done, you must enable ADM on your Amazon account.

trans-unit.source: The procedure is detailed at: [<html></html>].
trans-unit.target: The procedure is detailed at: [<html></html>].

trans-unit.source: Upon completing the procedure, you get:
trans-unit.target: Upon completing the procedure, you get:

trans-unit.source: OAuth credentials (a Client ID and a Client Secret) for Engagement to be able to push your devices.
trans-unit.target: OAuth credentials (a Client ID and a Client Secret) for Engagement to be able to push your devices.

trans-unit.source: An API Key that must be integrated into your application.
trans-unit.target: An API Key that must be integrated into your application.

trans-unit.source: SDK integration
trans-unit.target: SDK integration

trans-unit.source: Managing device registrations
trans-unit.target: Managing device registrations

trans-unit.source: Each device must send a registration command to the ADM servers, otherwise they can't be reached.
trans-unit.target: Each device must send a registration command to the ADM servers, otherwise they can't be reached.

trans-unit.source: If you already use the [ADM client library], and already have [integrated ADM] you can directly go to android-sdk-adm-receive.
trans-unit.target: If you already use the [ADM client library], and already have [integrated ADM] you can directly go to android-sdk-adm-receive.

trans-unit.source: If you have not integrated ADM yet, Engagement has a simpler way to enable it in your application:
trans-unit.target: If you have not integrated ADM yet, Engagement has a simpler way to enable it in your application:

trans-unit.source: Edit your AndroidManifest.xml file:
trans-unit.target: Edit your AndroidManifest.xml file:

trans-unit.source: Add the Amazon namespace, the file should begin like this:
trans-unit.target: Add the Amazon namespace, the file should begin like this:

trans-unit.source: Inside the tag, add this section:
trans-unit.target: Inside the tag, add this section:

trans-unit.source: After adding the amazon tag, you may have a build error if your Project Build Target is below Android 2.1.
trans-unit.target: After adding the amazon tag, you may have a build error if your Project Build Target is below Android 2.1.

trans-unit.source: You have to use an Android 2.1+ build target (don't worry, you can still have a minSdkVersion set to 4).
trans-unit.target: You have to use an Android 2.1+ build target (don't worry, you can still have a minSdkVersion set to 4).

trans-unit.source: Integrate the ADM API Key as an asset by following [this procedure].
trans-unit.target: Integrate the ADM API Key as an asset by following [this procedure].

trans-unit.source: Then follow the instructions of the next sections.
trans-unit.target: Then follow the instructions of the next sections.

trans-unit.source: Communicate registration id to the Engagement Push service and receive notifications
trans-unit.target: Communicate registration id to the Engagement Push service and receive notifications

trans-unit.source: In order to communicate the registration id of the device to the Engagement Push service and receive its notifications, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag (even if you use ADM without Engagement):
trans-unit.target: In order to communicate the registration id of the device to the Engagement Push service and receive its notifications, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag (even if you use ADM without Engagement):

trans-unit.source: Ensure you have the following permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml (before the tag).
trans-unit.target: Ensure you have the following permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml (before the tag).

trans-unit.source: Grant Engagement OAuth credentials
trans-unit.target: Grant Engagement OAuth credentials

trans-unit.source: Submit your OAuth Credentials (Client ID and Client Secret) at $/\#application/YOUR\_APPID/native-push.
trans-unit.target: Submit your OAuth Credentials (Client ID and Client Secret) at $/\#application/YOUR\_APPID/native-push.

trans-unit.source: You can now select "Any Time" when creating Reach announcements and polls.
trans-unit.target: You can now select "Any Time" when creating Reach announcements and polls.
